If your a fan of a open world game with exploration you‚Äôll love the legend of zelda breath of the wild it has an abundance of locations to discover and explore finding and completing all parts of the map will leave you satisfied even when that‚Äôs done there is so much more like side quests and for 900 korok seeds across the entire map is fun for those die hard gamer completion rate

Big and VariedThe amount of stuff to do in BotW is pretty impressive, there are plenty of places to explore, enemies to fight, items to find and quests to complete.This is the one of the biggest change ups to the Zelda formula since its inception, no more dungeons, in the traditional sense anyway, no more collecting items to advance to places you couldnt reach before. Now its about collecting monster parts, food, wood, flowers, pretty much everything. You use most of these things to create meals and elixirs that give you additional hearts and other benefits like stronger attack or defence.In place of the dungeons there are now shrines, (120 of them in total) which are more often than not in hidden or hard to find places, these are essentially mini-dungeons with 1-5 puzzles in them; you complete these to earn spirit orbs which can be traded in to give you more hearts or stamina (4 orbs = 1 heart or 1/5 of a stamina wheel). The shrines are great fun (mostly, screw the motion controlled hammers) and often offer multiple solutions using your weapons, bows or your new powers which replace the typical Zelda tools and can be used in a variety of ways. The Shrines and Powers combined wake for a great time and made the game really enjoyable, as did the new version of Hyrule, large fields, cold mountains and firey volcanoes are nothing new but now they are obstacles as well as environments, dont go to the mountains without warm clothing (or a fire sword) or you will freeze, arid deserts without heat resistance and you will dehydrate, this makes getting around a fun challenge in and of itself.On the flip side the new weapon system or more specifically the durability system is less welcome to me personally. Weapons, shields and bows now break after a certain amount of use, this can be annoying when you loose a weapon you like but there are plenty of them all over the place so it never became more than a mild annoyance. I also found the stamina wheel to be annoying initially as i didnt think the starting amount of stamina was enough as it greatly limits your ability to run, swim and climb (which you can do on nearly any surface), but a few shrines later and it wasnt a problem. The biggest negative for me in this game is that the story is weak in comparison to earlier titles in my opinion, nothing actually *happens* in the game, its all happened before you start, you can find flash back cut scenes but they didnt really do it for me, but your mileage may vary.Overall+ Great world to explore+ Shrines are fun+ Experimenting with powers is fun and rewarding+ Combat is fun and challenging- Durability system can be irritating- Stamina dampens the early game- Story is kind of absent

THIS IS A SPOILER FREE REVIEW :) (At the bottom is a full list of pros and cons, which is a summed up version of this review)Breath of the wild was an extremely charming and welcoming surprise for a gaming experience within the Zeldauniverse. Having fully played through the entrire game, i can say it was truly fantastic.It is a beautifully crafted world and filled with tons of content to enjoy. It is filled with some great detail, with each area of this open world, having some meaning or use - which is quite rare for an open world game, usually having irrelevant areas which are just there to fill time, this game it feels amazing to go off and explore.There are no restrictions, if you see something of interest - you can gon explore it. You will find yourself doing numerous side quests for fun and finding intriguing and challenging puzzles and enemies to test your wits and skills.Graphically this is one of the most beautiful looking zelda titles for a while, it feels as though it is a unique artstyle as many games take a modern approach to games in terms of realistic graphics, so this is a welcome differentiation.Whilst there is a story in this game, it takes more of a backseat to the world and gameplay, it is still present within the game - having a main goal backstory etc. However the story is quite nice to see and the cutscenes are fully voiced, which is a first for zelda, but was surprisingly good and a welcomed inclusion. The character of zelda felt a lot more developed than some of the previous titles in the series.GAMEPLAY, the gameplay is fantastic. There are so many new additions to the mechanics and a variety of fun random things you can do, it truly is amazing. There are so many weapons in this game, allowing for different ways to attack enemies, really keeps you on your toes. When playing the game, because the core mechanics are so much for, you find yourself creating and finding out new things to do all the time, you find yourself messing around having fun just creating stupid scenarious to kill an enemy - it can be really hilarious. The great thing anout this game is that i kept finding new things to do even late into the game, i had figured out randomly towards the end, i can pull my shield out, jump on it and surf down a hill. And i spent embarrasingly a long time doing this, and combining it with other mechanics into the game to do some really fun and stupid things.Bug wise i have personally not come across any throughout my whole playthrough, and i feel as though i did everything content wise that i could, and during this whole time i did not come across one bug.This is a truly fantastic game and i would recommend this to anyone whether you are a newcomer to the series or a longtime fan, it will truly be a fantastic experience for you. 10/10 game.Pros:Lots of contentAn amazing world to exploreNo bugs (personally)Beautiful graphicsMechanically fantasticA truly fantastic worldMusic is blended in well to fit the scenario of what is going on within the gameCons:The story, whilst still good, takes a little bit of a backseat in comparison to that of other zelda games.

This is a great game with some annoying "features". I love the Zelda franchise. It was the reason I brought the original Wii and it is the reason I got the Switch (although it couldn't entice me with the Wii U and that HIDEOUSLY huge and ugly controller). This takes the series and builds on it in a mostly positive way. There is very little in the way of hand holding and you are expected to go and explore and the surprisingly large open world. There is lots to see and do with many side quests that make you forget you are actually saving the world (or at least meant to be!).There are a few decisions with the game that I find frustrating. Your weapons die and you have to keep restocking them. I get that it makes you use lots of different weapons and try different tactics but when you find a weapon you like you don't want to use it as it will disappear eventually. The Witcher 3 had a much better 'degradation' mechanic allowing for the weapon to degrade over time but allowing you to repair it. The other part I find frustrating is the horse. I could be remembering wrong but in Twilight Princess you could just 'whistle' and your horse would appear. It's a little handwavium but it meant the horse was of genuine use in order to get about the huge spaces. BOTW has an even larger open world, but I rarely use the horse as you have to go to a stable to pick it up if you left it somewhere. It really limits (for me) how you use the horse. The game says you can whistle but the horse will only come if it is in ear-shot is it is "not magical". I get it, it is more realistic, but come on, this game has you beaming around the country using a mystical not electronic tablet that lets you take selfies without holding it! Can we just pretend that the horse (once you have fully broken it in) can be following you around just out of sight ready to come to your rescue?Aside from those couple of little rants (lol) I love this game. It is tough and challenging without feeling you can't do it. The side quests are reasonably interesting and some genuinely fun ones when you are exploring. I found one when I climbed a mountain - because it was there okay? ;) - where I had to rescue a spirit to access the shrine. It was genuinely surprising and finding out how to save the spirit was a fun challenge (even if you have to shoot it to save it?!).

It was watching someone playing Ocarina Of Time that made me buy a Nintendo 64 and I've owned all the major Zelda games since. Despite this, I've never finished one of them, or even got close. The linearity, ability gating and puzzles always result in my getting stuck somewhere along the line and giving up with an unfulfilled promise to myself to come back later. So the over-a-hundred hours I've put into Breath Of The Wild aren't just more than I spent in any Zelda before it; they're more than I spent in all the other Zeldas put together.When I first wrote this review it was after the first seventy hours, and even that was more than most professional reviewers were able to play before giving their 10/10 ratings. At that point I hadn't even completed a dungeon: now I've done them all and I feel that my perspective, if not my rating, has changed. This game is no respecter of your time: the world is enormous and wandering from place to place, climbing stuff, collecting stuff & unlocking stuff will take as long as it takes. More importantly, though, when you start you think in old-fashioned terms: "the Main Quest will be the biggest part of the game and these shrine things are just bite-sized puzzles". As time goes on, you finish the smaller, more visible shrines and suddenly start discovering the ones that take the time & trouble. After you've spent as long doing a shrine as you spent on a dungeon, you realise that "beating the final boss" (which I haven't) is no metric of completion in this game.Before you can do what you have to do you have to learn what you can do, and the game teaches you nothing: you either discover it for yourself through experimentation or happen across the NPC who can give you some clues. There's never been a game that needed a guide more and there's never been a game that would be so spoiled by using one. For example, there are several major abilities that I only found out about long after I could have received them, but that isn't necessarily a bad thing because I have tens of hours still to play.Breath of the Wild is not perfect; not nearly. Everyone seems to have their own pet peeve with this game: the stamina system; the cooking system; the frame rate; the inventory system; the weapon degradation. But most players seem to make peace with these small problems as the ticket price for the journey to the next magical horizon.This was what the promise of the Zelda series was always about ... it just took me a few years to find it.
Really good game, fantastic open world adventure and lots of stuff to do. It's also a great story, not too heavy on cut scenes.

Well what can I say? It's Zelda! Now this isn't the perfect game, but I have given it 5 stars because in my opinion there is nothing else quite like it on any other platform and I have had endless hours of fun and exploration.  I have spent most of my time playing Breath of the Wild in Handheld mode (which looks absolutely gorgeous by the way).  There is so much to explore and things to see and do that you can spend hours running round the map completely ignoring any objectives that you have.  I really like the whole open world idea and the shrines are a fresh take on mini dungeons.  I have a few gripes about the game though and these are only my personal opinions so feel free to agree or disagree.  First of all is the music.  The music whilst effective, is just not Zelda for me....it is used sparingly as you venture across the open world, but it does not have those memorable themes that I have come to love from Zelda over the years.  In my opinion there could've been much more effective music used in the over world and in the dungeons.  The second gripe I have is the *SPOILERS*Divine Beasts.  These are essentially the four main dungeons and whilst I think they are a good idea, they are just not dungeons to me.  They have 4 variations of the same boss, and without meaning to sound old hat I miss the Zelda formula of getting an item in the dungeon that you then have to use against the boss.  Again the music could've been more memorable for me.Those are the only real problems that I had with the game though, as I found the open world breathtaking and sometimes just stopped playing to watch a rain and thunder cloud move towards Link as the heavens opened and the rain came pouring down.  And the landscape is absolutely stunning as you run across the grassy plains with the sun rising above the mountains behind you.This game is fun! So much fun to play!  It's gorgeous in terms of it's graphics and lush landscapes and is the best game I have played in a long time.  There is so much to see and do!Well worth the money!

I purchased this game as back in the day I remember playing Zelda & recalled that it was a bit of an adventure game. It arrived speedily which was great, was well packaged & well presented, so would be ideal as a gift. So, the first mission of finding the 4 shrines & completing their tasks to obtain the orbs, - well finding the actual 4 shrines was the mission in itself! It took me almost a week to find them & complete them! At first I was tempted to give up, but I persevered & it was challenging, & I got there in the end! Once link has all 4 orbs, he has the 4 main powers of bombing, magnetism, freezing time, & he then also gets given the handglider -  which helps massively with regards to getting around from heights. This first quest prepares link to go further into the game. It gives him the skills & abilities that he needs, & it also makes him have to utilise his skills during the 4 shrine finding & completing task.The graphics are really good, and riding horseback is great, as is the cooking recipes, & what can I really say about fighting the monsters?! Only that the orange monsters are a lot easier to defeat that the green monsters. And watch out for that all seeing laser eye!Overall, a really good game of adventure. Tons of playability, & can even purchase expansion packs too. I would deffo highly recommend,  especially if you like a challenge!I hope this review has been helpful, xx

Update: I've been playing this game for 130 hours and still only done 1/4 of the main quest line! (I've done mostly side quests, but this shows just how much there is to do!!)This is kind of like a Nintendo take on Skyrim, in the sense of an open world and very diverse and versatile combat system.It reminds me of Skyward Sword, Windwaker and Twilight Princess; all rolled into one, but in such a marvelously succinct way. You can definitely feel that Skyward Sword was the greatest influence here, particularly in the visuals and many gaming dynamics (like the sail cloth, crafting and weapons/shields that break). But many of the best bits of those 3 games are merged in.You are gradually weened into a very diverse set of controls and play styles, but after you leave the starting area there's a massive element of "just go figure it out for yourself," in this game, which will be a refreshing experience for Zelda fans.Stealth, temperature, weather, climbing, cooking and potion making are just a few of the amazing additions to this game. You'd be forgiven for expecting these things to feel a bit crowbarred in or cumbersome, since Nintendo haven't ventured into too much depth with these dynamics in their past Zelda games. But, this is far from the case.Enemy AI is great. Enemies will try to use the environment against you, picking up weapons and throwing objects at you.Just a few small examples of attention to detail:* Temperature: If you're standing in the shade, your temperature drops and if you stand near a campfire, you get warmer* Stealth: Walking around in water makes more noise than on the ground* Climbing: Wet surfaces are slippery and harder to climb* Enemies: If you quickly disarm an enemy while they are throwing something at you, they won't notice and will continue trying to throw it, then will look confused when nothing happensThis game makes you wonder why you have to pay ¬£50 for some other games, that feel like they've not had 5% as much care and attention as what has clearly gone into this game. The bar has again been raised by Nintendo!

I've been gaming since the start and very rarely does a game come along that crosses boundaries and excels like this one. It's memorable great fun for all the family - even my non gaming wife has been drawn in to the family discussions about our "progress". That's a 40yo man, a 6 yo boy, a 3yo boy and a non gaming 38yo woman all hooked and enthralled by this beautiful, quirky, warm, exciting, epic quest of a game.As with all open world games the range of things to occupy your time is massive and varied but in this game things of particular note for me:Tthe way the difficulty is so well done. Boss fights are stiff and need a bit of forethought but are then very doable - I haven't been frustrated once, although I've been daunted 100times! Flying is a joy, cooking is fun and the fighting is so varied and the breakable weapons mean you have to keep it moving. This balance is never quite right but they've cracked it with this game.Small things that make the world more believable are beautifully done - sheltering in a cave as a storm rages only for a tree to be felled by lightning just outside ...just a wonderful world.Then there's the hundreds of puzzles that are woven in to the game. Varying from a simple bit of fun to real day-long head-scratchers for the family. And this indeed is how everyone becomes involved; before you know it how to complete the latest Shrine puzzle is the topic at breakfast and everyone has fun working it out and then completing it.I love the bow and how you have to allow for drop at range - a very satisfying weapon.The paraglider is a masterpiece - everyone should have oneI just can't say enough. Certainly a classic in the making and deserving of all the praise being piled on to it, this game is one of the most accessible and memorable games ever made on any platform.

How do I begin... Well, I think you are ready, ready to hear what happened 100 years ago.The beginning of this game throws you in at the deep end, you have little items, and little explanation of what you need to do, minus a few visual prompts (we've all seen the E3 treehouse, so I won't go much further). From there, you then have a few quests, and then, you're able to leave the Great Plateu and your journey truly begins.This is the first Zelda of its kind, it's now non-linear, you're not forced to venture down one path, and you're more not held back by needing a certain item to progress. However, Zelda does lovingly tell you in its own unique way, that maybe, just maybe, the path you went down, wasn't quite for you yet... and by that, I mean, you'll see A LOT of Game Over screens. This doesn't make you feel annoyed though, if anything, you want to accept the challenge and try to kill the enemy, or raid the bandit hide out.Breath of the Wild, is a breath of fresh air (I know, I did it), it's a master piece, and probably one of the best open world RPGs I have EVER played, and probably the best Zelda game to date. In this, you can do whatever you like, raid a camp, do a side quest, climb the tallest mountain, be killed by Ganon right at the beginning, because you thought you were gonna be a big man, and kill him after your 100 year slumber. The possibilities are almost endless, and it has SO much to offer, that yesterday, I stayed in a town for about 5 hours, just trying to complete some side quests. I have barely dented the map of BotZ, and I'm still wanting more.If you love RPGs, get it, get it some more, and then again and again. You won't regret this game, it's visually stunning, engaging, and has you laughing and intrigued through.

The item was wrapped, brand new as if I had bought it at the store. My daughter hasn't played any other game since she got this one. She LOVES it. She's got a couple of friends who are also into it and they talk about it all the time. I highly recommend this edition of the classic Zelda series if you've got a 4th grader who loves gaming. For everything this game does fantastically, there's always the looming feeling that this is just not Zelda, the huge lack of real dungeons, the jarring lack of any real overworld music and the way the Master Sword and Hylian Shield are treated among much more makes this feel very not Zelda-like, I only got the Master Sword because I wanted it, I never even found the Hylian Shield but I'm told it can break... Forever... How does the Hylian Shield break? That's just silly, the Master Sword running out of power I can accept but c'mon, the shield should he unbreakable. It feels like Nintendo were so quick to series routes for their idea of innovation, and that certainly works to its benefit, it's just jarring seeing how everything is so not Zelda. A great remix of the Overworld theme plays once you get to Hylia Castle and that's amazing, but it's possible you won't even hear it for upwards of 40 hours if you want to do a lot of shrines or side quests. If you're coming at this the strict desire to play a Zelda game, you'll likely leave disappointed, but if you just want a great game, BoTW delivers in every department

I've been a console gamer since the late '80s, and have always had a current gen console of some description at every point of my life since that time, but in recent years I'd kind of fallen out of love with gaming. It seemed harder to find the time to play, and any sessions I did manage to fit in were rushed and unenjoyable. My 360 and Xbox One were little more than FIFA machines, and if it hadn't been for the 3DS I'd have happily 'retired' from gaming and moved on. The the Switch was announced, and I impulse pre-ordered along with this game... hoping Nintendo could deliver a masterpiece that would get me back into it all. I really believed this was nostalgia talking, and I'd end up disappointed.How wrong I was. It's the deepest, most spectacular and well-crafted game I've ever played, and immediately reminded me why I loved gaming in the first place. The landscapes, the music, the atmosphere, the physics of the world and everything in it, the intuitive control method - it's all unbelievably good and just transports you fully into the game.I've logged well over 100 hours so far, and the game hasn't been far from my mind since it launched six months ago. I completed it months ago, but can't stop playing it. I make time to play it, and the Switch's portability obviously helps with this. The idea of playing the most detailed, biggest Zelda game ever on a handheld still blows my mind a little. I'll stick it on to travel to an area of the map I hadn't previously visited. I'll go for undiscovered shrines. Or I'll just stroll about and take in the scenery. It's almost like a second life in another world, rather than a game.It's a beautiful work of art.

Im a 45 year old gamer who back in the day sided with Sega, back then you chose a side, either Nintendo or Sega and that was that. It was akin to supporting a football team, and Sega was my team.Since then my irrational teenage loyalty has waned, I've owned every Playstation & Xbox console & Ive also owned (or I should say my son) has also owned an N64, DS, Gamecube & WII. I've always appreciated the TLC that had gone in to games like Windwaker, Mario Sunshine, Smash Bros & Metriod etc. The game mechanics were always flawless but I had never had that wow moment or had a real connection with a Nintendo game. I just preferred GTA, Red Dead, Skyrim, God of War etc. I put it down to my age & that Nintendo was aimed at the younger me who had chosen Sega.Then this Christmas my son had a Nintendo Switch. After a quick blast on Breath of the Wild I was impressed. Then after another go I was even more impressed. And then I was absolutely transfixed. The game is absolutely glorious! The game design & mechanics are flawless. The graphics are beautiful, & the open world is engrossing & extremely challenging.This game is absolutely captivating and oozes charm. An absolute all time classic!

I have played all the games in the Legend of Zelda series and I must say this is definitely as good as (if not better than) Ocarina of Time, which is still the highest rated game on Metacritic.Breath of the Wild (BotW) is vastly different from any other game in the series, as once the "tutorial" section is finished, you can go to any corner of Hyrule. No where is off limits provided you are equipped with the right clothes, food and have enough stamina to climb and swim long distances. You're given all the Sheikah Slate abilities you will need throughout the "tutorial" rather than having to unlock them as you progress through the game. It's up to you to figure out how is best to use the abilities to succeed.There is a strong survival element to BotW which I see a welcome change to the series. It can be difficult at times, but once you learn how to effectively dodge, counter and apply your Sheikah Slate abilities to both enemies and to the environment, a whole new world of possibilities opens up. (For example, setting fire to a big patch of grass can cause a nice little updraft to start paragliding from rather than jumping off a mountain or building)I am over 45 hours in and would say that I am probably half way through the game. I like to take my time and I often find myself getting distracted by the scenery or just wandering off the beaten path looking for something interesting (you're never far from a new challenge)I can't get enough of this game at the minute and highly recommend it to anyone who owns a Switch (I haven't tried the Wii U version so can't comment on the performance).

Admittedly it took me some time to get into Breath of the Wild as it is somewhat a departure from the Zelda I know and love and there are still some things I dislike and truth be told I still prefer previous more driven style with no open world and larger dungeons but the more time I put into BotW the more I fell in love with it.I'm not really a big fan of the more grinding element of having to grind for raw ingredients which might be for eating, upgrading or selling for rupees but it's not a necessarily a bad thing and a lot of people like this.I was on the fence about the difficulty at first as I felt Zelda shouldn't be an overly difficult experience but again the more you put in and level up, get new gear and simply improve then you come to appreciate what Nintendo were thinking.The graphics are stunning, the open world fun to explore and the Shrines (mini dungeons) are very fun to figure out and always give a sense of satisfaction once you've worked out the solution and complete it.You will get potentially easily get a couple hundred plus hours out of this game as there is so much to do and see.Breath of the Wild's sequel has just been announced so if you haven't I highly recommend jumping into BotW asap.

I'm a huge Zelda fan and have been playing Zelda since the beginning.I was really worried about this Zelda the same I was originally really worried about Wind Waker. And like Wind Waker, I was very, very pleasantly worried about nothing.Here are things that aren't great about Breath of the Wild:Music : aside from 2 or 3 tracks the music is extremely mediocre. It's a disappointment compared to past Zelda games where the music is legendary.Dialogue : Sometimes the dialogue choices that you are forced to choose from are extremely frustrating because they force you to sound like a petulant little brat. You'll have a choice between petulant child and arrogant turd.Monster diversity - There's very little of it.Dungeons - They aren't the same and the equivalent "shrines" don't add up to the usual Zelda dungeons.Story - About as basic/generic/boring as you can get.DESPITE all of this, this game is easily 5 stars because of how fun it is and how many hours you'll put into it. It's not my favorite Zelda game ever, but it's certainly the one I've spent the most hours playing, and that's within a month of owning it. I've put a good 400 hours into it over 3 playthroughs. Never have I beaten a game only to be excited to literally, literally immediately start back up.The fact that this game has so many flaws and yet is so amazing and so wildly successful and critical received tells you just how good it is.

Let me start this review by saying that this is my introduction to the franchise. I‚Äôve heard of the Legend of Zelda before, I‚Äôve watched countless videos talking about the rich history of Hyrule and all of the games; but I‚Äôve never picked up and played one before.I saw the immense popularity this game had gotten over the last year which swayed me to lay down the money and get the game.And let me say, without a doubt it is easily one of the best games I‚Äôve played this year and this past decade.Allow me to explain why:This game is one of the games where player freedom is put centre stage, and allows for some truly immersive gameplay. Without going into spoilers, any busurd and stupid idea you might come up with is possible. I would liken the player freedom in this game to something like Metal Gear Solid 5, which also allowed complete expression through the mechanics.Also like Metal Gear Solid 5 though is that the story is easily the weakest part of the game, and almost feels like an afterthought.Despite that though, I can tell that this game is going to continue to bring me back for dozens upon dozens of hours and allow me to create my own experiences that no other game can quite match.TLDR; Nintendo have still got it and remain the centre of innovation.

It‚Äôs a very different Zelda title, but it is quite simply brilliant. It may take some gamers time to get into because it‚Äôs all about Hyrule and learning about the environment while surviving off it as well. You can take pride and time to develop link and learn about the world and how to combat the evil that lies out there. Typical Nintendo have made a very slick combat system for the game, but it‚Äôs about choosing your battles and using the land to gain advantages where you can. The game looks amazing and plays like a dream. It certainly takes a bit of time to open up but the puzzles you face in the shrines, the open world environment to explore in, the combat, and the climbing. Even gathering ingredients for the cooking to gain an advantage or help survive a bitterly cold mountain you have to explore to find something is hugely fun and rewarding as you see Link improve his abilities and enhance his equipment or amour. It‚Äôs a fantastic game that any RPG/open world/Zelda fan must experience.

This is by far the best game I‚Äôve ever played on any platform ever. Lol‚Äî sounds dramatic but seriously this game has everything you‚Äôd want: adventure, mystery, action, magic, exploration, treasure, and so much more. You‚Äôre free to explore the insanely detailed terrain however you want, follow certain main story goals or take a side quest detour. I‚Äôve never been more immersed in a game before in my life.

If you play this game to blast through the story, you'll probably be a bit disappointed, but that would miss the point. The true joys lay off the beaten track. The huge map can seem a bit empty at first glance, especially when compared to the dense clockwork of puzzles that made up previous entries in the series, but allow yourself a moment to relax, explore and get sidetracked and you'll discover that the best stories in this game are those that write themselves as you play. The way that everything reacts with everything else in this game creates a toybox you can experiment with for tens of hours and never get bored. I'm far too lazy to go into much more detail than that, but trust me, this is one of the most enjoyable games of the last decade or so. Buy it, sit back with a cup of tea and have fun.

this is the best "video game" i have ever played - i am not a hardcore gamer, but due to my age, have played a fair few titles over many years, and this is the most solid, comprehensive, huge!! experience i have had the pleasure to immerse myself in.having seen the abundance of 5 star reviews and praise for BOTW, i did feel as though this was potentially hyperbole from zelda/nintendo fanboys, but what other choice of game was there for us day 1 switch owners?admittedly, even for the first few hours of play in breath of the wild, good as it was, i thought those were still very high praise reviews indeed, little did i know that the arc of the game had yet to unfurl into what it would soon become, which is nothing short of genius in my book.i am a slow-ish player having spent a few hundred hours of play, and only just finished all of the shrines, side quests, shrine quests, memories, divine beasts, and ganon a few weeks back, my only teeny tiny gripe with the overall completion system is i am only showing 32.34% done!!this is because i only have 122 korok seeds out of about 900 - maybe too many? :) that's a positive negative though, complaining about too much gameplay is better than saying there wasn't enough! can't wait for the DLC'sp.s. having wolf link to accompany me on my travels of hyrule was another inspired touch!

Probably one of the best adventure games out there and its nearing 3 years old already.make sure to select your missions on the shiekah slate and it will give you the location of the mission on the map, there are a lot of side quests compared to the main story ones, i have a feeling most people who found this game boring were just wondering around aimlessly not knowing where to go or not knowing the difference between side missions and main story on the slate. Also the first area of the game (the great plateau) is basically one big tutorial and its easy to go and explore which will get boring because your character has no weapons or special abilities or armour (you're practically level 1), you have to complete all of the tasks before you can leave it and explore the rest of the game with out restriction, once the great plateau (Tutorial area) is completed then the game truly shows its worth.=) Have fun!

This game is absolutely deserving of its perfect scores. An absolute masterpiece on all accounts.I've got a super high end watercooled pc so i know good graphics when i see them. The lighting effects,  the scenery, the 'cell shaded' style really works in the world of hyrule. The music suits every scenario, birds chirp from every corner of the room and the mysterious voice echos around the room. Physics on a zelda game,  never thought I'd see the day tbh. Everything you do can have an effect on the world around you. Experimentation with cooking ingredients gives you all sorts of potions,  elixers and power ups. For instance,  the cold near killed me. No problem, throw 5 chilli peppers in a dish to make a strength and cold resistance meal. Seriously fantastic stuff from nintendo here.The open world of hyrule is vast and huge and I literally can't wait to explore it all. Littered with bogoblin hideouts and outposts and vast mountain ranges,  its a sight to behold and you will be sharing your pictures on social media, trust me!The best thing is I'm just getting started, I'm only just scratching the surface here.Please please please, just buy a switch if only for this game. Its nintendos mona lisa, their sistine chapel, their statue of david! Its that good. If this is a taste of things to come then I can tell you nintendo have cemented their future financially, as well as in the history of gaming. For that I thank them,  and you will too. Enjoy!

i love open world games, but sometimes they can get boring. but not this. it has a perfect balance between freedom to do what u want, and also difficult challenges and the main storyline. there's just so much attention to detail, beautiful graphics and it's overall a fantastic game.

It has beautiful graphics. The puzzle dungeons are second to none, some of the best in any ARPG of all time. And the variety of ways the enemies interact with the environment and each other is spectacular.And nearly every other aspect of the game is aggravating at best and irresponsibly and unprofessionally designed at worst. You're a wet paper bag that is OHKed by everything for most of the game, and not from lack of skill, but because all enemies were made to be bullet sponges to artificially boost the difficulty. RAIN, 'nuff said. NO MUSIC. You walk slow, you run slow, you climb slow. Cutscenes and unspoken dialog are unskippable. Repeated popups are unskippable. NO MUSIC. Weapons breaking could easily have been made non-frustrating, but it was not. NO MUSIC. Puzzle dungeons are cool but there's no classic dungeons - the big puzzle dungeons don't count and there's only 4 of them anyways. And there's 120 of them - if you don't do a large percentage of the 120 of them, you're still a wet paper bag trying to fight Gannon. NO MUSIC. The lead designers of this game need to be strapped down to a chair and forced to actually play through their own game, from end to end, with no help, on camera. They'd be screaming for the same minor changes necessary for smooth gameplay that the rest of us have been screaming about, and maybe their ego would come down a few notches. NO MUSIC. Beware playing this game. Some aren't bothered by these issues, but some place this last in the entire line of games in the entire franchise, and I'm one of them. NO MUSIC.
I'm very happy I got the game.

A good game, really the best reason to buy a Switch. The open world is the star of this game. It is huge and you can go pretty much anywhere. It is marred by the bizarre breaking weapons for me, however, and the story takes a back seat, being conveyed only through flashbacks that really seem just an add on, so I didn't feel like I had been on an epic adventure as I had with previous Zelda titles or develop any meaningful empathy for the characters. Also, completionists will be disappointed; the grind to find all Korok seeds and complete all shrines is exactly that, just a grind, and the reward, even if you are hardcore enough to do it, is pathetic. Oh, and the DLCs really are not worth it, they just add more shrines essentially. But this isn't a review of the DLCs. If you own a Switch, this is the best game on it, period, but the deliberate prioritising of open world freedom over narrative is weighted too far in favour of the former to really cement a place in my video gaming memories as a classic.

The best game I have ever played! At least best modern game. (Can't beat Super Mario World).Ok that may not be the case for everyone. But I was seriously not expecting how good it is. I was excited for the Nintendo Switch for games like Snipperclips to begin with, and Mario kart/Splatoon/Mario Odyssee later on. But I found that I have spent a lot of time already playing this game.It is no short game either, it has a lot of side quests, and the open world is Huge and NOT EMPTY as some were worried about. There are lots to do everywhere.But on a more serious note, it is a brilliant game, with much to do. It still feels like a zelda game, despite a difference in the way you play. The story is very gripping, and is more so if you have played previous Zelda titles.The controls are good, the visuals are good, (yes there are games with better graphics, but you can only go so far, and it is still a big leap from previous gaming generations).The title in a way describes it well... "Breath of the Wild". You have lots of freedom, to do what you like in what order you like. It is a welcomed change from previous Zelda games.

It seems futile to write a review on this game when everything has already been said by greater and more established gaming websites, YouTube channels, magazines, PRACTICALLY EVERYONE AND THEIR DOG.  But I like to chime in with my two pence worth when I purchase something.It's a fantastic game.  Nice depth of story and combat mechanics revitalise the long established Zelda/Link franchise.  A substantial number of gaming hours can be put into the game if your intention is to cover all the quests, side quests and items to be found.  I've yet to complete it having purchased it on its launch (March 2016) but this, in my opinion, shouldn't be a game that you should run to complete - in this age there always seems to be a hurry to 'beat' a game.  The beauty of the Nintendo Switch system is that you can take the game with you on the go and resume a title as and when you like with little to no delay.This is a flagship title for the system and despite being available on the Wii U comes off as the better version.  A must have title for the system.

There is so much to explore and do in this game. I even challenge myself to parts of the domain I'm not even powered up for, can get tricky avoiding certain characters but its a lot of fun. Definitely one of my more favorite games.

Have always been a Nintendo fan but recently fell out with games consoles in favour of PC gaming.  I wanted the Switch purely for Mario Kart and hopes of a new Pilotwings game.  Since there are still hardly any games, I plumped for Zelda despite being pretty "meh" about the whole thing (loved Ocarina of Time but was a bit Zelda'd out!).This game is awesome.  Do not worry about the comparably low power of this console because Zelda has the power of Nintendo under its belt! Little touches like fish swimming in lakes, birds flying in the sky and little fairies buzzing around trees are the sorts of immersive little touches that only Nintendo bother to add to their games.Despite borrowing a little "tower climbing" from all the same-old-same-old Ubisoft games, Nintendo have done it right here - getting to the top lets you look out across the map - and the map, oh the map...  it is huge! We've been playing for 2 weeks now exploring here and there and floating off mountains using the paraglider and still only just uncovered half the map!Lovely, absolutely lovely.  And plenty in the tank for lots of hours of fun with this one.Thanks Nintendo!

I bought this a couple of years ago and played it to death, 100's of hours which I usually don't do and there is still things I've missed, for me this has become the best game I've ever played, taking the place of the last of us, I have actually struggled with playing any other games after I finished this, because I rate everything else against it, it took me months to finish god of war on the PS4 because I kept going back to my switch to play Breath of the wild, It may not be for everybody, but for me as someone who loves all LOZ games including majora's mask it's a thing that I believe should be experienced by everyone

I am a casual gamer and probably won't manage to beat this game since there isn't an option to change the difficulty. I nearly gave up on this game several time because I kept having to run away from enemies and I was sick of having my weapons break.It took quite a while to build up Link so the game becomes more fun. Now I pretty much just use Switch to play this game. The loading time is surprisingly quick for such a big game, which mean I can easily play for 10-15min if I was short on time.

A great game only one problem it's extremely inconsistent hoe some creatures oneshot you.An how the same creatures sometime only do 3 hearts the bosses patterns are inconsistent for example thurnderblight Ganon sometimes charges you and sometimes he throws balls before charging you.Once you get to the third phase it's even worse he can brake your shield or make you drop it but it's extremely difficult to run from him.While fighting him during the third phase I noticed a lack of patterns and most of his attacks can kill you in one hit.The stamina system also ruins the game as you can't climb in rain and simple things take up stamina bars.The fact that you weapon can break is a tremendous problem too.I fought waterblight Ganon and I walked In with 6 weapons left with one.These mechanics are kinda stupid.Since once a player loses all their weapons during a boss fight they are completely screwed.
This was working great but then the card stopped reading after 1 month of use and i only played it for about 10 hours in that month. My other games still work so its not the console.

Make sure to buy the expansion pack as soon as possible. Some of its features will improve your experience throughout, for example it unlocks the feature that shows on the map where you have already walked.

I know, sacrilege, but I can't give something 5 stars just because everybody in the world did!  Don't get me wrong, the scale is epic, the story is detailed, the puzzles are great, and the hours of gameplay in this is bordering on the ridiculous.  But, that's part of my gripe - there is just too much to do and too many combination of things to get my head around.  Just don't have the time or energy to do this game justice, which is a shame, but that's why I gave it 4 stars.  I can totally understand though, why fans of the series gushed over this game, and I'm sure the follow-up will be just as good.

I bought this not expecting to get along with it - I was raised on Sega so anything with this many control buttons (switch) gets a bit confusing for me. I needn't have worried, it has beocome the most popular game in our house since Mario racing! Both my partner and at least one of the children have completed it multiple times for the story, for the achievements, and for completionist attempts. Well worth the cost given how good the game is and the amount of play time we've got out of it!

I play a lot of games across every console imaginable and this is definitely one of the best I've played. Don't be put off by the art style I'm in my late 20's and this game offers plenty of challenges. The best part about it is that you can walk in any direction at any point and be constantly finding things to do - the game world isn't just big for the sake of it. I've played for >25 hours so far and feel like I've only just got started. I don't normally spend much time away from the main storyline/quest in big games because I tend to find them long enough as it is but this one is a definite exception to that.One suggestion - don't ruin all the surprises for yourself by watching videos or reading too many spoiler articles online, the best moments are the ones where you stumble across something that you never expected and the feeling of "wow" is irreplaceable.The only downside is whatever game you play after this is going to feel really rubbish in comparison! I really hope Nintendo can produce more games of this quality for the Switch going forward.

I was about 10 months late to the Switch Party and only bought one because Bayonetta 1, 2 and 3 was announced for it - THIS game had already been crowned Game Of The Year by quite a few outlets. Playing it now I can see why.This game, at a glace, may seem like: "Oh they've made a Zelda game open world like GTA or Skyrim..." But the thing is, they've actually made a Zelda game that does everything better. The more hardcore Zelda fans might boast about how they finished it with 3 Hearts while only wearing their blue shorts in 39mins... but this game has more to offer than that... and DESERVES more from the player I think.I advise any new players, like I was, to just ignore the internet and jump into the game and learn how to cook from trial and error, learn how to fight each foe, seek out those secrets. I've been playing this for days and I don't even feel like I am "avoiding the main quest" or "Looking for stuff to do". Every journey I make ends up an exploration, the world in this game is very well done.

Purchased from Game Planet Implex for 5200/-.Must buy game. However if purchased pre-owned it will be a better deal as the new one import date is old therefore you will not receive Nintendo gold coins as per Nintendo reward program.Hence it makes no sense to purchase new copy rather purchase digital version or pre-owned (game card) version.

I left this review for a while whilst I played through hundreds of hours before making a judgement. I considered many points that I was going to include in my review, but the fact is, unless Nintendo developers are going to read this and take on-board my minor annoyances and suggestions, there is no point. All you care about is whether it is any good and worth a go. And to that question, the answer is it doesn't get much better than this.It has now been nearly a year since I played it, so I have had plenty of time to reflect and change my mind. Now I just miss it. There are a few disappointing elements but it really is a master piece and I expect it will go down in video game history.
The best game I've played in years

Has to be one of the best games ever written.  Beautiful world, richly populated with people, flora and fauna and loads to do.  Wander aimlessly taking in the scenery, stock up on ingredients for cooking up health and stat boosting meals and elixirs, take out the bad guys for loot and weapons, plan your attacks using bombs, magnetic manipulation, mastery of time or ice pillars. Solve the puzzles in the shrines to upgrade hearts and stamina, glide from towers and mountains, catch, tame and ride horses, find koroks to upgrade inventory slots, mine rocks for minerals and precious stones, use the camera to take pics of everything you come across, swim in mountain lakes and maybe even up waterfalls if you're lucky, help many people on numerous side tasks Oh, and there's the main quest to tackle too. All activities play out in a logical fashion and the game always seems to remain true to its own internal rules and systems.  If you have a Wii U or are thinking of getting a Switch get this game and lose yourself in Hyrule, it's a beautiful, dangerous land and you won't want to leave once you start.  10/10

Brilliant game , and I highly recommend it. This is the type of game that‚Äôs fun even when ur not playing it. Since I have a projector, I get to enjoy this whole new engrossing world on my whole entire wall, and lots of times my family comes to watch and commentate, and it‚Äôs fun for all. Literally spent about 50 hours completing 10% of the game. Then again I‚Äôm a perfectionist and won‚Äôt rest until every side quest is complete, but overall brilliant game.
This was purchased as a requested Christmas gift so hopefully they will like their choice.  She was very excited to have a game for herself and NOT her children.

Solid gameplay, fun open world. My only complaint is that I have a switch lite so some of the tilting puzzles are almost insanely difficult on a portable device!DLC is also worth picking up, but none of the new outfits that are found in it have a decent armor rating, so they‚Äôre almost purely decorative and rarely worth wearing.
Purchased for our 11 year old as Xmas present.  I think everyone pretty much know how good this game is...was highly recommended to us so we had no doubts.Fantastic game.

I finally beat the story last night and I want to dive straight back into Hyrule to discover all the secrets that still await me. This adventure is a little different to other LoZ games but it's no worse for it, in fact it's better than all of the others. Sure there's no big dungeons but BOTW straddles perfectly between handheld accessibility and home console grandeur. The shrines are just the right size to beat on a commute, whereas the vast open world is a sandbox for explorers and adventurers to seek out formidable enemies or hidden treasures.An absolute masterpiece, though still with a couple of minor flaws. The sequel needs to have fishing and the ability to pet the dogs, then it will be perfect.

I have been playing computer games for so long it makes me feel old just thinking about it. The last great game I played and got totally engrossed in was Fable. I read a review on this likening this to Fable and I had to buy it. To be fair I've always been a fan of Zelda, wether it be on the game boy, yes the original game boy, the Nintendo 64 or any other platform it's been created for. This has massively ticked every box a zelda game should and so much more. Having completed it after 100's of hours of gameplay I'm a little sad but I'm looking forward to the add on material. It just a game that keeps on giving, every part of the world is different. Play this, I promise you won't be disappointed. I have a habit of collecting so much in a computer game the game gets boring and I never finish the storyline, I never even for a moment thought that was going to happen with this. Best game in years.

For me, Wind Waker was the peak of the Zelda series. I was hoping for more of the same, with different graphics. However this game takes on the open-world RPG approach, somewhat similar to the large, open-world Skyrim, but with the playfulness of Zelda.The game is simply huge. I was about 20 hours in when I got told the game is well over 100 hours. If you've got time to play games, this is a good, long adventure. if you're wanting a game to pick up and put down, then you might struggle to ever beat this one. Overall, you get your moneys worth, and it's an enjoyable adventure. Giving it 4 stars. Wasn't overly keen on the RPG-element. I'd rather they left that to Skyrim/Final Fantasy.

Love the zelda series in games, so obviously was dead excited to get this! The graphics were amazing the game is huge as I still have not finished it yet. I do like to take my time with games, this game is abit different to the others though obviously its bigger and doesn't have as many dungeons in it more trails.Other then that if you have never played the zelda series or want to try it or like your rpgs this is suck a great game!

I had my concerns if Nintendo would pull off a massive open world game, but they were put to rest shortly after booting up the game for the first time.The map is enormous, but so much content for players exploring this world, to the point that its easy to forget your main objective with the side quests, shrines and collectibles. There is so much to find.The different power ups and items Link receives throughout the adventure helps make the world feel like a massive playground.The graphical art style is a sight to behold. It's hard to believe that this game looks this beautiful when played in handheld mode. The musical approach is unique but it works within the world. Through my experience it changes based on the situation, particularly when up against some of the game's bosses.This is the main game anyone should buy when purchasing a Switch, first time I have played witness to a launch title of this caliber since Super Mario 64. Just rating it 5 stars would be an injustice to this game.
Great item.. Speedy delivery.

I've been wanting this game for a while now and I have to say that I couldn't be happier with my purchase since this game has been keeping me busy on long days since I received it. Along with the purchasing of the DLC for the game, I am 100 per cent certain that I've found my favourite game at the moment!

Loved this game, 100% it once and then 98% completed it a 2nd time but my ex stole it and kept it for her self along with other nintendo physical copy games i have...sadly can't fully complete this masterpiece again

The best game I‚Äôve ever played! This truly brought so much nostalgia and brilliance to a Nintendo game that I‚Äôm at a loss for words. As a fairly movie gamer this RPG game is ‚Äòbreath‚Äôtaking - The attention to details and the nods to past Zelda games are fantastic! It‚Äôs gaming style is easy to follow along with and it just so expansive you will spend hours and I mean HUNDREDS of hours exploring this world!

Sadly i think the people who have reviewed this so highly have never played any of the older Zeldas  It's not a patch on ocarina of time or majoras mask or even a link to the past it's sorely let down by a terrible stamina system and weapons that break even the master sword needs to recharge which is terrible then there's the world which whilst huge its hampered by temperature changes and huge cliffs and is also way to empty then there's progression which is pretty much none existent i was finding myself been one shotted in the late game by essentially the same enemies I've killed throughout all because of having to change armour for different areas ! Now it's not an awful game i enjoy the shrines and it does make most of the limited power the switch panther but it just isn't a zelda game to me
Really enjoyed this game a lot!
killer

Great game. Even for a 40 yr old me its tricky and needs a lot of thinking and combat training. Quiet a long game. Its taking me almost a month around 2 hrs everyday five days a week. Great graphics... infinite options in this open world game. Too realistic concepts and tricky. In short a great one to own. Will surely play it once more....
Great game!
Tassy like;)

This believe it or not is my first Zelda. I've got to be honest when i first started playing i thought what the heck have i wasted my money on but then through just relaxing, taking it easy and exploring, the charm of the game suddenly hit me. It's unlike the games i usually play and that's why i didn't get it at first but once it clicks it's just a magical experience.
Bought as an Xmas present . Fantastic
Box arrived damaged and cracked. No plastic sealed packaging. Not entirely convinced this is a new game. Would not recommend this item.  Had this been intended as a gift I would have returned it.

I cannot express the simple pleasure of capturing your first wild horse, taming then naming it and then just riding off together over vast grasslands.....,cooking that perfect dish with ingredients you have gone out and harvested yourself. Climbing huge mountain ranges through extreme weather, feeling on top of the world. Rafting down fast paced rivers with just a leaf. I am meant to be saving the world but I am having too much fun exploring it. A game that can make you feel like you are travelling through ancent world's.All this and puzzles, trials, side quests and all the usual extra-special Zelda moments.It isliterally a game-changer in the console world..Are there any downsides? It is addictive on a whole new level....you have bee warned!!!And the story line is scary for little ones so when kids are around just settle for catching a horse or go bug hunting :).Enjoy the freedom!
Molto impegnativo per un bambino, per√≤ molto bello

This is my first Zelda game and after the first 10mins I didn't realise what the fuss was about.  I then spent another 30mins deciding if I would keep the game or not.  I'm so glad I kept playing.  3 weeks later and I have played this game every day and at every chance I get.  I am still not anywhere close to completing the main game and still have all the side challenges to start too.  As a gamer for 25+ years I think this is the best game I have ever played.  The imagination of the story, the open world scenery and gameplay, the range of difficulty of the puzzles, the creativity needed to survive through harvesting food to cooking and receipes for elixirs, the weapons, the enemies etc.  It's amazing and will be game of the year, decade and possibly best game ever.  10/10.

While graphically the game looks amazing, I absolutely hate the stamina system because it severely hinders you for most of the game. Especially with such a heavy focus on traversing large terrain and climbing up mountainsides or gliding. All of this requires stamina and until you grind out a ton of shrines to increase your stamina, You are gonna be severely limited very easy on.And on top of that, The weapons now break and since most of them break after only a couple of hits, You have to be very selective about what enemies you choose to face and the only weapon that doesn't break is the master sword so good luck getting that. These two things are a very annoying change and until you grind out at least half of the shrines in the game to level up your health and stamina, You're pretty much gonna be going nowhere fast.BOTW frustrates me beyond my wit's end because of these ridiculous changes that make the game needlessly difficult when it didn't have to be.

I think I read somewhere that the whole world of Twilight Princess fits in just the starting area.  I believe it.This game is huge!  There's so much to do!  This is, without question, one of the best games I have ever played.  It's a wonderful experience from start to... well, I've finished the main game but I'm still playing because there's still so much to uncover.  You will get hours of joy from this game; it's incredibly fun.I haven't touched the DLC yet as I want to find everything the base game has to offer, but I will be buying it to try Master Mode once I'm ready.I only really have a couple of gripes, such as some things being Amiibo-exclusive (e.g. Epona, the Twilight Bow and the Traveler's Bridle and Saddle, to name a few) and a couple of the motion-control shrine puzzles.

One of the greatest games ever made. Takes the attention to detail and incredible game design found in all the Zelda games and applies it to an open world like Skyrim all while adding a bunch of tricks of its own. A beautifully realised world where you can go anywhere chocked full of puzzles to solve, secrets to find, monsters to fight and quests to complete. Looks absolutely stunning as well, one of the prettiest games on the Switch.

This is without a doubt the best game I've played.It's not often you can play a game so open as this and with endless ways around completing tasks and quests.When I bought the switch, I was a little worried about the fact that on paper, the console isn't as powerful as the competitors. However, Breath of the Wild has proven that power isn't all that's required to make a game beautiful. The art style, landscapes and gameplay flow and awe you as your story throughout Hyrule continues.So far I have between 40-50 hours gameplay and I've still not completed it. This is probably due to the fact I've enjoyed exploring, climbing and running for dear life at times before I remember I was just about to look for the next part of my quest.Overall, extremely impressed. Thanks Nintendo for such an amazing game.
Gift

Absolutely fantastic game.I have played many games and this has to up there with the best of them. I've not played any Zelda games previously yet I still managed to easily follow the story line and learn about the main characters. The game world is incredibly interesting and kept me exploring it for ages. The main quest will take a decent amount of time and there is also several side quests to keep you going if you don't want to follow the main quest. The art style is definitely unique but doesn't' feel wrong and helps creates a great atmosphere. The game also has a nice difficulty curve, it may seem relatively hard at first but when you get used to the mechanics you'll quickly get better but at no point have I ever found the game too easy.If you have a switch this is a must have.
We have always loved Zelda and this one certainly doesn't disappoint. Would definitely recommend.

Quite simply the best videogame of all time. I am absorbed after 8 days playing and at night I dream of discovery and shrines to uncover. The sheer thrill you get just from trying things out is intense. The game world is the size of 7 entire cities from gta5 and the scope for doing things and being creative is much higher. This map is bigger than any other videogame I can think of and contains thousands of little bits to do everywhere. Breathtaking! Smashes the Witcher 3 for game size and scope of design. Just a flawless product and crazy that we can even get something this perfect and this complete for normal retail prices of ¬£45-¬£55. Intense value and a game noone can hope to best within 3 months. This beats any experience I've ever been lucky to have on any system of any type over the decades. I'd give it 99/100.

The game does a lot of things very well: the graphics are lovely, the gameplay is fluid and fun and the world is fun to traverse but it is by no means perfect.While the world space is expansive and fun to travel, it is sparse, best way to describe it is "Wide as an ocean, deep as a pond". Enemy camps and boss battles are fun, shrines are a fun challenge (though a little simple) but the majority of puzzles you find in the world are the Korok seed challenges, these are often repetitive and overly simple.The game has plenty of good ideas which it executes well, but the bad drags it down a little bit. I'd still recommend it but it wont be everyone's cup of tea.

My first experience playing Zelda was on the Nintendo 64 with Ocarina of time. For any real Zelda fan this is a must buy. For any adventure game fan this is also a must buy. Breath of the Wild is one of those very few games in the past couple of years that has really tried to innovate it's games design and in doing so created a very fun and enjoyable game that tells a very fresh tale about Link in a vast open world game. This is a living and breathing world you explore battling a large number of interesting enemies and picking up upgrades for Link aswell as new weapons to keep the combat interesting. The game alone is stunning and for a console that is able to be played in handheld mode your going to be putting ALOT of hours in to this one. Do yourself a favour and pick up the absolute marvel of an experience you will not be disappointed.

Great game for the switch, looks as good on the big as on the small screen. The graphics aren‚Äôt as rich or vivid as I remember from games such as the ocarina of time, but I think that‚Äôs intentional to fit with the story line. Gameplay is strong, the story as always with a Zelda game is compelling and well structured. Intuitive and challenging enough to maintain interest.
Bought as a gift, recipient very happy with it. I‚Äôve had a go myself since and it‚Äôs a big challenging game but worth the effort as the graphics and gameplay are awesome.

Absolutely stunning game. Not at all disappointed. Have been playing Zelda games since the gameboy and SNES versions came out. It's evolved into a beautiful game with even more depth.I'm liking the temples as they're short and you don't end up in them for days.The ability to get fairly big items that you used to get further into the game (like bombs, bows and other powers) is really great as it opens up the whole thing.Really enjoying the size of the game without being too bombarded by annoying characters or gimmicks (like the irritating time demands of Majora's Mask). Feels like you can explore far more than previous Zelda games.So whilst I'm probably not very far into the game given the size of it - I think this is by far the best Zelda game yet.

This was my first game for the Switch and it's looking good. Only just starting so a long way to go.There are a lot of controls to learn/remember and there were NO instructions included with the game. There was an empty clip in the case that held the game card, so I contacted Nintendo support and asked about the "missing" instruction booklet.They told me that they didn't provide a booklet!  I can't believe at the price that they charge for this game they can't include a basic guide to the controls - absolute cheapskates.

I've always been a fan of Zelda - this is by far the best Zelda I've played and so far I have only played for 4 hours! This was the reason I bought the Switch - I tried not to, buying Horizon Zero Dawn for PS4 so that I could convince myself Zelda and the Switch was not needed - glad I took the plunge, this is the best game I've played in years, literally.So far, it is still about learning how to play - but as Nintendo does, this is very well integrated into the story line overall. Can't wait until I have more spare time to play this - I literally had to make myself leave this at home before heading to work today!This game is vast - I shall certainly be taking my time to explore everywhere.

Excellent but overrated. Discovering new areas is wonderful fun but most temples are repetitive and unexciting. Combat is too easy and dull. Without the expansion packs replay value is limited. On the Switch Lite the screen is too small to do this game justice and the experience suffers. Still beautiful to behold while it lasts.

My son had this as a Birthday present and he has literally become a character in the game he gets so immersed into the game. He uses all of his screen time allowance every other day on this same game. He is determined to complete this game, hopefully it takes him a long time, get our monies worth then :)

I've only ever played one other Zelda game on the DS (Majora's Mask) and I never finished it mainly because it wasn't mine and I kinda forgot about it, however, I loved this game, no matter how long I played it I never got bored since there was always something to do, some side quest I haven't finished, some person I haven't helped, so many ways to solve a problem.seriously if you are looking for a real open world adventure game, that gives you the choice to follow task or just do whatever you want, then this game is for you!The only con is that I wish you could befriend the dogs and have them follow you around permanently, but then I'd be sad if they died during a fight or something so um... nevermind.good game 10/10
Great game but I'm pretty sure I got it because I could and not because I wanted it, cheers chaps

I bought this at launch as all the trailers had looked good and I needed a good game to play at launch. The best way to think about this game is it is a Nintendo take on Skyrim. Hyrule is a vast, beautiful interesting world full of interesting areas (icy mountains, hot deserts, luscious jungle) and quirky characters. The world is the main reason for playing as well as the journey from a week link to getting the Master Sword and of course defeating the Evil Ganon. Overall the story is ok but the people meet, the areas you go and the mechanics are simply superb.In short if you have a switch or are an open world fan this game is simply a must play!
Don‚Äôt need to say much this is probably the best game on Nintendo switch

The Legend of Zelda Breath of the Wild is the first true open world game in the Zelda series. Nintendo's main goal at the beginning was to evolve the series and honestly, they couldn't have done a better job. On Nintendo Switch the game runs at 900p on the TV and 720p in handheld mode. The gameplay is magnificent and the story, characters, graphics and the physics engine really enhances the experience. If you have played any of the games in the series I highly suggest you play this game and if you're new to the series you should do the same, because honestly this game is a true masterpiece. Only minor complaint would be the fact there's not as many dungeons as past Zelda games and the final boss is a joke, but that still doesn't effect my perfect score
I‚Äôd been recommended the game from a friend and i do not regret playing it. From graphics to storyline to even basic game functions it is amazing! I look forward to the next game!!

Fantastic game! I‚Äôm not a gamer, but during lockdown I git bored and decided to treat myself to a switch. This game was fantastic. I lost myself in it for hours at a time. Loads of adventures, quests, battles, puzzles... this game has so much to do, you can play for as little or as long as you want. Highly recommend to both hard core gamers and those like me who never game.

This is one of the greatest games I've ever played.  Beautiful artwork and animation. Unbelievably gorgeous music.  Intriguing puzzles and a dynamic that allows the player to be motivated to keep exploring and become part of the adventurous legend and story.  Five Stars ...it deserves nothing less.

Holy God this game is fantastic, and its not a walk in the park either. What sets tihs from other Zelda games and most games today is the lack of tuturial at the beginning of the game. You walk out only knowing the very basics which you have to find out ot get out, and the rest you explore to find out, experiment etc and it makes for a whole new challenge, but its fantastic. If you want you can walk to the final boss as soon as you start the game, thats how open it is, but you wont win, but you can try.Anyone who has a switch must have this, or be insane not to have this, this is the only reason to own a switch at this point
Wurde verschenkt, die Freude war gro√ü.
Great and legendary game
This game is worth it for anyone looking for an adventure and you have plenty of time on your hand, don't let it fool you rhough the difficulty is a challenge

Literally the best game I‚Äôve ever played (other than oddworld), love that it‚Äôs open world so endless fun. You have plenty of tasks to do but you can freely travel around by foot, horse or glider (still early days in the game). So much fun! Delivered super quick as well, thanks!

Amazing game for everyone that loves a good open world game. The graphics are astonishing and the soundtrack is perfect for all the different scenarios. The only thing that I didnt enjoy is the fact that you can't craft items.Really recommend it!

Ordered this for my 8yr old son.The game was ¬£60 with Nintendo online, but ¬£45 to ¬£47 for the physical cartridge with most retailers. Thought this was poor form from Nintendo as we wanted the download version.Ordered from Amazon for ¬£45. Case arrived and when my son opened it there was no cartridge present. He was so upset, I went and paid ¬£47 for the game at Argos and later sent the empty case back to Amazon.Great service as usual from Amazon when dealing with the return.Poor experience from Nintendo for their dubious online pricing and sending empty cases.For the game itself  my son loves it.We will be buying all games in store in future and checking the case before leaving the shop.
My grandson loves it
Bought as gift and very much appreciated
Great game, one of the best I‚Äôve played!

Although I bought this product "NEW" there was a slit in the plastic wrap and when my partner opened it for Christmas the game cartridge was missing and he noticed the inside of the game box was scratched up where someone had shoved something inside to pop the game cartridge out. I have been a Zelda fan for a long time. My favourite was ocarina of time and love all the others afterwards. Skyward sword came close to being my favorite but just missed. Bought this for the hysband for his birthday. (NO SPOILERS) This must be one of the best games I have ever played. It's so much fun. There is just so much to do, the world is MASSIVE, the graphics are gorgeous and music is fantastic. I just wish we could carry more weapons though because there are so many cool weapons in the game.It's one of those games that will also make the time fly. Sometimes I'll just be 'that area down there looks interesting', 2 hours later I'm still exploring it. Highly recommended.

Definitely the best Zelda ever! I have now played it for a week and I find it difficult to put it down. There is so much to explore and do, I don't get bored. It is a different concept from what we are used to with the former Zelda games but the improvement is fantastic. I particularly like the open world, the fact that you can explore so much and you can tackle the game in any way you want to. I am thoroughly impressed and can't recommend it enough. Also, although expensive, because it is so massive, I will have hours and hours of play so worth the money. A word about Amazon service: it was great, as always. Thank you!

I remember playing the original when I was a youngster, but oh boy have the graphics moved on, absolutely great, enthralling game. You can stop, save the game and return to where you left off ... take as long as you like and enjoy a great game.

Less reviews than I would have expected; I think everyone has been too busy playing it to write reviews!Truly an amazing game.  Vast, rich, and detailed.  It's a good progression of the Zelda series; it has changed a few of the fundamental mechanics of the game, but in very clever and well thought out ways, and without losing it's identity as a Zelda game.  I've personally never been as much of a fan of Zelda fan as Nintendo's other franchises, but this release has changed that for me, and is one of my favourite games I've ever played.  And as a bonus, it's so big, I'll be playing it for some time to come...

I've never been a big fan of Zelda games (I've tried Ocarina. Wind Waker. Twilight Princess and the DS ones but never clicked with them) but decided to grab this after the overwhelmingly positive reviews.After a week of solid play I can honestly agree it is a wonderful game. It's a brilliant game and it looks fantastic.  Easily recommended.
